string.text: Spotters module main configuration
What is Spotters? Spotters will be explained one day
Spotters
When a squad joins you there is a slim chance that one of its member has the Spotter perk. This stalker will have this perk until he dies, so keep tabs on him
Upon joining you will be notified if a squad member has the Spotter perk with a news notification on your pda
A squad member with the Spotter perk will mark the first enemy he sees whenever he or the squad enters in combat. This is followed by a voice cue (bark) from the squad member
The marker will stays on the enemy, until dispelled by the life timer or when getting too close or too far away from it
When multiple spotting, the next spot is done only after the previous spotted enemy is killed
Hold hotkey (default companion wheel key C) to call new marks. You can change this below
Call Mark hotkey
Hold this key to call a new mark
Perk chance
The chance a squad member that joins you has, to spawn with the Spotter perk
Marker life
Time in seconds the marker is shown
Keep spotting
Your squad will keep spotting after the first enemy. Beware!! You are entering skill issue territory
Max simultaneous marks
If you enable keep spotting, the Spotter in your squad will keep adding new marks unless this limit of active marks is reached
NPC Bark
The squad member that calls the mark, issues a voice bark as well
